title: The Nigerian drummer who set the beat for US civil rights
description: Babatunde Olatunji was part of a generation of Africans who fought for racial justice in the US.

title: Iran nuclear deal: Why US 'snapback' sanctions on Iran could fail
description: The US is in a legal muddle over its efforts to re-impose sanctions on Iran, says Prof Marc Weller.

title: The nudists spreading coronavirus in a French resort
description: An outbreak of Covid-19 has hit 30% of those tested in the popular naturist village of Cap d'Agde.

title: Live video dating: Finding love online with an audience
description: A new breed of app is allowing people to go on live video dates, while others watch on.

title: BTS tell fans to 'stay strong' during difficult year
description: Speaking to the BBC, the K-pop group reflect on their US pop success and support from their fans.

title: George Floyd death: What’s changed, 100 days later?
description: A protest movement reborn, colonial symbols destroyed and policing scrutinised.

title: Black Lives Matter: 'I refuse to let a slaver take my name away'
description: When the statue of Edward Colston was pulled down in Bristol during the UK's Black Lives Matter protests, it had special resonance for one man thousands of miles away.

title: Toast impressionist inspired by Edvard Munch and other masters
description: A homeworker expresses her frustration at the impact of coronavirus through the medium of bread.

title: Huw Edwards: My grandfather, Prisoner of War
description: The BBC newsreader and presenter visits the remains of the German POW camp where his grandfather was held.

title: Chadwick Boseman 'was a real-life black superhero'
description: The actor's role as Black Panther has left an impact on young black people.

title: GCSEs and A-levels: Decision on exam delay promised 'very soon'
description: A delayed start could be part of changes to next summer's GCSEs and A-levels in England.

title: Marcus Rashford brings food brand giants together to tackle child food poverty
description: The Manchester United forward says he is confident his taskforce can change lives for the better.

title: Spurs could face Botosani or Shkendija in Europa League
description: Tottenham will play Romania's Botosani or Macedonian club Shkendija in the third round of Europa League qualifying if they defeat Lokomotiv Plovdiv.

title: Tens of thousands of Scottish pupils absent from school
description: Scottish government figures show that more than 13% of pupils are not in class - mostly for non-Covid reasons.

title: What tasks lie ahead on the return to Westminster?
description: As Parliament returns, what's in the government's in-tray?

title: Coronavirus: Portugal return to quarantine list would cause 'chaos'
description: The head of BA's parent company warns against new measures, as coronavirus cases in Portugal rise.

title: Jacob Blake: Father 'refuses to play politics' as Trump visits Kenosha
description: President Trump will meet police but not the family of a gravely injured black man when he visits Kenosha on Tuesday.

title: Chadwick Boseman: Netflix postpones Ma Rainey's preview
description: The film, Boseman's last screened performance, is due out later this year.

title: Australia: Snakes crash through roof of house
description: Two carpet pythons found slithering about a house in Queensland, Australia, may have been love rivals.

title: Ocado cancels orders on first M&S delivery day
description: Angry customers have complained on Twitter, but Ocado says a "very small number" of orders were hit.

title: Coronavirus: Jobs furlough scheme unwind gathers pace
description: The government is reducing the amount of furloughed workers' wages it pays from 80% to 70%.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown pupils are three months behind, say teachers
description: As schools in England return, researchers warn pupils had fallen behind by the end of last term.

title: Resurgent Sale, bold Northampton and training 'going to zero' - Premiership talking points
description: BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones on Sale's disciplined revival, Northampton's selection inspires neutrals and why midweek training has "gone to zero".

title: Girl, 15, died of 'abdominal injury' in Solent boat crash
description: Emily Lewis was one of 12 people taken to hospital after a boat collided with a buoy.

title: Ed Sheeran and Cherry Seaborn announce birth of daughter Lyra
description: The singer tells fans his wife has given birth to daughter Lyra, their first child.

title: Shake diet offered on NHS to fight type 2 diabetes
description: Thousands more people in England will be encouraged to try the weight loss plan.

title: US Open 2020: Naomi Osaka through but Coco Gauff out in New York
description: Former champion Naomi Osaka overcomes a scare in her US Open first-round match, but American teenager Coco Gauff is knocked out on day one.

title: Thunder force decider with Rockets in NBA play-offs
description: The Oklahoma City Thunder produce a late comeback to force a decider in their NBA play-off with the Houston Rockets after a 104-100 win.

title: David Silva: How do Man City replace their creative star?
description: David Silva has been one of the best players to grace the Premier League in the last 10 years, but now Manchester City must work out how to continue without him.

title: Bella Thorne, OnlyFans and the battle over monetising content
description: Content creators say OnlyFans has slashed incomes by placing caps on prices charged on the platform.

title: Britain's Norrie shocks ninth seed Schwartzman in US Open thriller
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie fights back to beat ninth seed Diego Schwartzman, while Kyle Edmund also wins on day one of the US Open.

title: Coronavirus: How teachers are feeling as schools return
description: Four teachers share their experiences of the pandemic as they prepare to welcome pupils back to school.
